title: I'm going to get downvoted to hell for this
body:
But every game is not winnable. There are some games where you lose based on either the champ pick or the people on your team, in this case I am going to talk about the people on your team. No matter what higher elo players tell you, you cannot win if the enemy team gets over 20 kills ahead and they know what they are doing. This game is at least 30% luck. There is no possibility to carry if your team won't group, if the enemy ADC is killing you in 5 hits even with armor, if your teammates cannot take objectives, and if any other reason comes up that denies you the win.
I'm not saying you should FF at 20 becasue your mid lane lux gave up first blood, oh no thats a tiny setback that most likely not affect much in low elo. What I am saying is that NOT EVERY DAMN GAME IS WINNABLE.
This is a bronze QQ thread and I don't give to shits that it is. It's no different than people whining about DQ getting them matched with "bad players who got boosted" but it's not wanting Soloq back so it's going to get lost in the downvotes.

The reason higher elo players tell you every game is winnable is to get you playing every losing game as if you can win.  That's how you should be playing, even if there's no possible way you can win.

You can't outright tell someone with a defeatist attitude this or else they will just ignore you, so you have to sugar coat it until they reach a point where they can fully understand what you're trying to say.
Partially true, also in lower elo, throwing is very common for multiple reasons.
Had a game on my smurf the other day where we were down by about 15 kills at 20 mins. We won because they kept giving away free teamfights and objectives.

Had something similar happen in [one of my recent games](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2180671907/200604827?tab=overview).

We were down 10k Gold, 25 kills, two Barons and a couple dragons.

Nevertheless, we managed to stall out their barons, steal one of the Elder Dragons and kill 4 members of the enemy without losing anyone during the last teamfight.

After that, we just shoved down the mid inhibitor tower, inhibitor, both nexus towers and the nexus before they respawned.
----------------
Throws happen at all levels of the game.
Even in LCS?

Even in LCS.

How many LCS games do you think have been turned around due to Baron steals, a properly executed wombo-combo, repeated picks or backdooring?
CLG vs RNG #MakeNAGreatAgain

If you can't win then why are you still playing the game? It's better to ff if you are 100% going to lose, you save yourself time and possible frustration.

I actually don't know why so many people have been replying to me as if I said you shouldn't surrender.  Surrendering is a great option to get out of a losing game.

What I'm saying is, even if you plan on surrendering at the 20 minute mark, you should keep playing as if you're trying to win until that point happens.  Until the surrender vote successfully happens you're not done with the game, and so you should keep trying.

I think my main problem is what most people's definition of "100% going to lose" is. Being 8 kills down but now towers down shows that the enemy team isn't grouping for objectives with their kills - if the pattern continues it becomes a much easier to win game. So don't FF!

The only time I think surrendering due to a "100% lost game" is valid is if you've either lost at least 1 inhibitor or inhib turret very early or you've lost all but your inhib towers very early. Any point before that I think a game is still winnable, regardless of what the killscore is (since kills don't blow up your nexus)
If you deserve gold+ and you're in bronze nearly every game is winnable outside of the insane circumstances.

It's more like, you could probably win a lot of the games you think you have no chance of winning if you had better game knowledge/mechanics, or are good at coordinating your team and bringing out their potential in team fights using well-timed pings and positive/objective comments.

When you lose a game, there may be a lot of things a top tier player would have done in your place that game which wouldn't have even crossed your mind as a possibility.

That said though, there are those games which are just straight out unwinnable no matter what you do, or how good you are. But they are far and few between.

You're right that not every game is winnable. However, most games are. If you're teammates are not surrendering, they probably have legitimate reason to believe they can win the game.

Most of the time, the people who claims a game is "unwinnable" have no idea what they're talking about. Look at the recent MSI game CLG vs RNG. NA was going against the #1 undefeated Chinese team. They battled on while down 20k gold. twenty-thousand gold. They won. They won because they knew they had a better teamfight comp, and that if they can survive until everyone has items and gold leads becomes obsolete, they can win teamfights and the game.

So no, I don't care if the enemy team's ADC is fed and 5 shotting our tanks 25 minutes into the game, because if I see that my team can get their shit together and turn it around in the next 15 minutes and stomp - I'm not going to surrender.

And also keep in mind that some people are better at different stages of the game. Some are bad at laning phase. Some are bad at mid-game objectives, Some are bad at lane pushing. Some are bad in teamfights. If you're team doesn't know how to take objectives, they might be godly in late game teamfights. All you have to do is get to the teamfight stage and take charge when it's time to push objectives.

Some gives are indeed unwinnable, but these games usually involves and afk/troll/disgustingly unbalanced teams.

No, they aren't.  A game is winnable for a team if there is a possibility for that team to win.  A game can only be unwinnable for one team, but it very much can be winnable for both (for example, it usually is winnable for both at least until first blood, and often even beyond that point).

I disagree on the 'if your teammates aren't surrendering, they probably think you can win' bit.  I see more people who when asked say 'never surrender', or 'it's a learning experience' than that they think we can win.  The first sentiment is just stupid period, and the second one is stupid beyond a specific point.

I don't mind waiting until actual teamfighting starts, but if we're 40 minutes in, haven't taken an objective, haven't won a teamfight, and aren't insanely ahead in kills, then it's probably time to surrender.  There's a point beyond which wining becomes so unlikely that you're almost certainly wasting everyone's time by just not surrendering.

You're not wrong. 
From my experience, 20% of all games are up to chance. Incompetent teammates have a far larger impact than decent teammates. Depending on who you and your opponents get paired with, some games are guaranteed wins or loses.

That said, I've also noticed a trend that all my friends above Gold rarely surrenders.
Even if your team is 10k behind in Gold, there is still a chance you can win. Forfeiting the game means that you give up that chance. In every game, no matter the circumstance, you need to play as if you can win. If you are unwilling to do this, get out of ranked. You won't ever get a decent rank with a poor attitude.

On the current patch, all it takes is one good team fight in the late game to win. If your ADC is alive, you can break through all 5 towers down mid during the death timers. I have seen many games won while the winning team is in deficient because they managed to aced the enemy team a single time.

The only time I would choose to forfeit would be if my teammates were trash. By that, I don't mean TF players who go 0/3 against Zed or junglers who accidentally gave a double kill due to an outplay. I'm referring to those who are trolling, those who have no idea how to play their champions, and those who are boosted.
From my recent ranked games, I can only think of 2 instances in which I encountered these kind of players in my game. I had a Vayne who kept trying to face check bushes and refused to stay behind back lines. She went something like 1/10. My team still managed to drag the game out to 40+ minutes, but atlas she got caught and we lost. It was probably inevitable, but my team and I still played the game out.
In the other game, I had a Leona one trick who got hard countered. She flamed the entire team after feeding despite everyone else telling her that she can't just engage as Leona against Morgana in lane. I was playing with friends during that game, and we surrendered that one because we didn't want to deal with her.

Unless your teammates are bad, don't surrender. The odds for victory may be low, but giving  up is essentially the same as throwing these games. It might not seem significant now, but these losses will accumulate in the long run.

Pretty much. This is a team game, and you only have absolute control over yourself. You are only 10% of the overall in game decisions and actions by players, and only 20% of your team's input. 

It doesnt matter how well you do, it matters how well your team does. Unless you severely outskill your opponents and get lucky in being able to get free solo split pushes, you arent going to solo carry. Your team will need to pull *some* degree of weight. 

Very few games are winnable solely by you. Most games are winnable as a team. But some games your team just wont be able to pull their own weight, or you wont be able to pull yours. Be it teamcomp, D/C, troll, inexperience, lag, enemy team being that much better in general compared to your team, some games are decided at champ select.
